message.content:
{"id": "13269", "title": "Incorrect operation order in jarpackager", "description": "When using the jarpackager in the Eclipse IDE, there is an incorrect operation order that can occur. This issue also applies to '.jardesc' files. It would be better to show a warning in the wizard's header when using the '.jardesc' file, rather than displaying a dialog box at the end. To reproduce the issue, follow the steps below:

1. Select some packages and export a jar file.
2. Select 'Export java source files and resources'.
3. Click 'Next'.
4. In the 'Save description of this JAR in workspace' option, choose a .jardesc file that already exists.
5. Click 'Next'.
6. Select 'Use existing manifest from workspace' and choose a manifest file that already exists. Note that this is easier if you run the wizard once and then run it again with the preserved settings.
7. Click 'Finish'.
8. A dialog box will appear asking if you want to overwrite your .jardesc file. Choose 'NO'.
9. Another dialog box will appear asking if you want to overwrite your manifest file. Choose 'NO'.
10. An error dialog will appear stating that JAR creation failed, because saving the manifest to the workspace failed and saving the description to the workspace failed. Click 'OK' to return to the wizard.
11. Choose 'Cancel'.
12. Go to the location where your .jar file was supposed to be generated and observe that it was indeed created.

The incorrect operation order results in an error when saving the manifest and description to the workspace, causing the JAR creation to fail. This issue can be resolved by fixing the operation order in the jarpackager."}

origin.input_prompt:
Your role is a senior software engineer, you are very good at analyzing and writing bug reports.
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections.  In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements.  Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}
origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '13269', 'title': 'Bug 13269Incorrect operation order in jarpackager', 'description': "Bug 13269Incorrect operation order in jarpackager Same goes for '.jardesc' file.prehaps a warning in the wizard's header (now that an icon is shown as well)would be better in the case of the '.jardesc' file then a dialog box at theend. If the user wants that they should use the 'save the manifest inthe workspace' option combined with the 'reuse and save the manifest in theworkspace' option.20020409. JRT. ", 'OB': '', 'EB': '', 'SR': "Steps:1)select some packages and export jar2)select 'Export java source files and resources'3)Next4)select in 'Save description of this JAR in workspace' a .jardesc that alreadyexists.5)Next6)Select 'Use existing manifest from workspace' and choose a manifest thatalready exist (this is easiest if you run the wizard once and then a secondtime with the presevered settings).7)Finish8)A dialog will appear asking if you wish to overwrite your .jardesc file.Choose NO.9)A dialog will appear asking if you wish to overwrite your manifest file.Choose NO.Note that an error dialog appears saying JAR creation failed, because savingmanifest to workspace failed and saving description to workspace failed. If youclick okay you will return to the wizard.10)Choose Cancel.Go to were your .jar file was to have been generated and note that it wasindeed created. "}
